codelist.label: WRB Reference Soil Group (RSG)
codelist.definition: list of possible reference soil groups (i.e. first level of classification of the World Reference Base for Soil Resources). The allowed values for this code list comprise only the values specified in â€•World reference base for soil resources 2006, first update 2007.
codelist.description: Reference Soil Groups are distinguished by the presence (or absence) of specific diagnostic horizons, properties and/or materials. NOTE The WRB soil classification system comprises 32 different RSGs.

document.label: World reference base for soil resources 2006, first update 2007, World Soil Resources Reports No. 103, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, Rome, 2007 (p. 51-66)

value.label: Acrisols
value.definition: Soil having an argic horizon, CECclay < 50%.
value.description: Soils with a clay-enriched subsoil with low base status and low-activity clay

value.label: Albeluvisols
value.definition: Soil having an argic horizon and albeluvic tonguin.
value.description: Soils with a clay-enriched subsoil with albeluvic tonguing

value.label: Alisols
value.definition: Soil having an argic horizon with CECclay >24 and BS < 50%.
value.description: Soils with a clay-enriched subsoil with low base status and high-activity clay

value.label: Andosols
value.definition: Soil having an andic or vitric horizon.
value.description: Soils set by Fe/Al chemistry with allophanes or Al-humus complexes

value.label: Anthrosols
value.definition: Soils profoundly modified through long-term human activities.
value.description: Soils with strong human influence and with long and intensive agricultural use

value.label: Arenosols
value.definition: Soil having a coarse texture up to >100 cm depth.
value.description: Relatively young sandy soils or sandy soils with little or no profile development

value.label: Calcisols
value.definition: Soil having a calcic or petrocalcic horizon.
value.description: Soil with accumulation of calcium carbonate and no accumulation of more soluble salts or non-saline substances

value.label: Cambisols
value.description: Moderately developed soils in relatively young soils or soils with little or no profile development

value.label: Chernozems
value.definition: Soil having a chernic or blackish mollic horizon.
value.description: Soils with accumulation of organic matter, high base status and black mollic horizon

value.label: Cryosols
value.description: Soils ice-affected by permafrost

value.label: Durisols
value.definition: Soil having a duric or petroduric horizon.
value.description: Soils with accumulation of silica and no accumulation of more soluble salts or non-saline substances

value.label: Ferralsols
value.description: Soils set by Fe/Al chemistry with dominance of kaolinite and sesquioxides

value.label: Fluvisols
value.description: Relatively young soils in floodplains or in tidal marshes

value.label: Gleysols
value.description: Groundwater affected soils

value.label: Gypsisols
value.definition: Soil having a gypsic or petrogypsic horizon.
value.description: Soils with accumulation of gypsum and no accumulation of more soluble salts or non-saline substances

value.label: Histosols
value.definition: Soil having organic matter >40 cm depth.
value.description: Soils with thick organic layers

value.label: Kastanozems
value.definition: Soil having a brownish mollic horizon and secondary CaCO3.
value.description: Soils with accumulation of organic matter, high base status and brown mollic horizon

value.label: Leptosols
value.description: Shallow or extremely gravelly soils

value.label: Lixisols
value.definition: Soil having an argic horizon and CECclay <24.
value.description: Soils with a clay-enriched subsoil with wigh base status and low-activity clay

value.label: Luvisols
value.definition: Soil having an argic horizon and CECclay >24.
value.description: Soils with a clay-enriched subsoil with wigh base status and high-activity clay

value.label: Nitisols
value.description: Soils set by Fe/Al chemistry with low-activity clay, P fixation and strongly structured.

value.label: Phaeozems
value.description: Soils with accumulation of organic matter, high base status, and any mollic horizon"

value.label: Planosols
value.definition: Soil having reducing condition and pedogenetic abrupt textural change.
value.description: Soils with stagnating water and abrupt textural discontinuity

value.label: Plinthosols
value.description: Soils set by Fe/Al chemistry with accumulation of Fe under hydromorphic conditions

value.label: Podzols
value.description: Soils set by Fe/Al chemistry with cheluviation and chilluviation

value.label: Regosols
value.description: Relatively young soils with no significant profile development

value.label: Solonchaks
value.description: Soils influenced by water salt enrichment upon evaporation

value.label: Solonetzs
value.description: Alkaline soils with a natric horizon

value.label: Stagnosols
value.description: Soils with stagnating water with moderate textural or structural discontinuity

value.label: Technosols
value.description: Soils with strong human influence containing many artefacts

value.label: Umbrisols
value.description: Relatively young soils or soils with little or no profile development with an acidic dark topsoil

value.label: Vertisols
value.description: Soils influenced by alternating wet-dry conditions and rich in swelling clays
